title: Small demo of the sim.realistic.data package
text: Let us first load package example data. , survival dataset, can use get.summstat.survival function get summary statistics survival data can used generate new data. can choose mathod 1, 2, 3, , corrsponding (1) multivariate normal thresholding B, (2) multivariate normal thresholding B, regressing B, (3) regressing B, chain regression methods, (4) summary statistics needed three methods, respectively. See details manuscript. demonstration get using method 1, multivariate normal thresholding:
code: library(sim.realistic.data) data(example_data) E <- example_data$E Y <- example_data$Y X <- example_data$X B <- as.matrix(example_data[, c("B.1", "B.2", "B.3", "B.4")]) A <- as.matrix(example_data[, c("A1", "A2")]) summstat.survival <- get.summstat.survival(E, Y, X, B, A, method = "1") str(summstat.survival) #> List of 12 #>  $ n                     : int 240635 #>  $ P.presc.topK          :'data.frame':  1 obs. of  1 variable: #>   ..$ 30: num 0.00485 #>  $ prescription.mode.topK: num 30 #>  $ adj.coef.event        : Named num [1:13] 15.249 -1.126 1.088 -0.553 -0.484 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:13] "Intercept" "X" "B.1" "B.2" ... #>  $ adj.scale.event       : num 1.32 #>  $ logHR.X               : num 0.854 #>  $ coef.XonZ             : Named num [1:12] 0.309 -0.734 -0.25 -0.541 -0.443 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:12] "" "B.1" "B.2" "B.3" ... #>  $ P.ord                 :List of 6 #>   ..$ B.1: num [1:2] 0.88 0.12 #>   ..$ B.2: num [1:2] 0.824 0.176 #>   ..$ B.3: num [1:2] 0.75 0.25 #>   ..$ B.4: num [1:2] 0.498 0.502 #>   ..$ A1 : num [1:4] 0.217 0.237 0.25 0.296 #>   ..$ A2 : num [1:5] 0.212 0.23 0.201 0.181 0.176 #>  $ Quants.norm           :List of 6 #>   ..$ : num [1:2] 1.17 Inf #>   ..$ : num [1:2] 0.929 Inf #>   ..$ : num [1:2] 0.675 Inf #>   ..$ : num [1:2] -0.00459 Inf #>   ..$ : num [1:4] -0.784 -0.117 0.535 Inf #>   ..$ : num [1:5] -0.799 -0.145 0.366 0.931 Inf #>  $ Corr.norm             : num [1:6, 1:6] 1 0.54673 0.64219 -0.00637 0.17162 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:6] "B.1" "B.2" "B.3" "B.4" ... #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:6] "B.1" "B.2" "B.3" "B.4" ... #>  $ simple.coef.cens      : Named num 4.98 #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr "Intercept" #>  $ simple.scale.cens     : num 0.781

title: Small demo of the sim.realistic.data package
text: Now, abstract summary statistics, summary statistics sources, can use generate.data.survival function generate new survival data. Also, can designate hazard ratio treatment effect new data. example:
code: data(summstat.survival) summstat.survival = list(summstat.survival) simulated_data_survival <- generate.data.survival(n=100,Summ.Stat=summstat.survival,method=1) head(simulated_data_survival) #>   B.bin1 B.bin2 B.bin3 B.bin4 A.cat1_level1 A.cat1_level2 A.cat1_level3 #> 1      0      1      0      0         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE #> 2      0      0      0      0         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE #> 3      0      1      1      1         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE #> 4      1      1      0      0          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE #> 5      0      1      1      0          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE #> 6      1      0      1      1         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE #>   A.cat2_level1 A.cat2_level2 A.cat2_level3 A.cat2_level4 X Y   E #> 1         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE 1 0 185 #> 2         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE 1 0  49 #> 3         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE 0 0 198 #> 4         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE 1 0 170 #> 5         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE 1 0  48 #> 6         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE 1 0  46 simulated_data_survival_HR <- generate.data.survival(n=100,Summ.Stat=summstat.survival,method=1,set.logHR.X=1.5) head(simulated_data_survival_HR) #>   B.bin1 B.bin2 B.bin3 B.bin4 A.cat1_level1 A.cat1_level2 A.cat1_level3 #> 1      0      0      0      0         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE #> 2      0      0      0      0         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE #> 3      0      0      0      1          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE #> 4      0      0      1      1         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE #> 5      0      0      0      0         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE #> 6      0      0      0      1         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE #>   A.cat2_level1 A.cat2_level2 A.cat2_level3 A.cat2_level4 X Y   E #> 1         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE 1 0  43 #> 2          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE 1 0 107 #> 3         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE 1 0  75 #> 4         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE 1 0  82 #> 5         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE 0 0  35 #> 6         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE 0 0  36

title: Small demo of the sim.realistic.data package
text: Similarly, can use generate.data.binary function generate new binary data: demonstrated data generated using methods package similar performance bootstrap resampling method. However, resampling method requires access original data, methods package require summary statistics. addition, methods package can used flexibility generate data different treatment effects, scenarios including censor types. details method performance package, please refer manuscript.
code: data(summstat.binary) summstat.binary = list(summstat.binary) simulated_data_binary <- generate.data.binary(n=100,Summ.Stat=summstat.binary, method=1,set.logOR.X=1.5) head(simulated_data_binary) #>   B.bin1 B.bin2 B.bin3 B.bin4 A.cat1_level1 A.cat1_level2 A.cat1_level3 #> 1      0      0      0      1          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE #> 2      0      0      0      1         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE #> 3      0      0      1      1         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE #> 4      0      0      0      1         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE #> 5      0      0      1      1         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE #> 6      1      1      0      0         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE #>   A.cat2_level1 A.cat2_level2 A.cat2_level3 A.cat2_level4 X Y #> 1         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE 1 0 #> 2         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE 1 0 #> 3          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE 1 0 #> 4         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE          TRUE 0 0 #> 5         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE         FALSE 1 0 #> 6         FALSE          TRUE         FALSE         FALSE 1 0

what: Generating data with binary outcome — generate.data.binary
title: Generating data with binary outcome — generate.data.binary
text: Generating data binary outcome

title: Generating data with binary outcome — generate.data.binary
code: generate.data.binary(Summ.Stat, n = NULL, method = 1, set.logOR.X = NULL)

title: Generating data with binary outcome — generate.data.binary
text: Summ.Stat nested list element list summary statistics specific data site, formatted consistently output get.summstat.binary function n number samples generate, default using sample size summary statistics method specify type data generation method, consistent summary statistics input. Options including 1, 2, 3, corresponding multivariate normal thresholding B, multivariate normal thresholding B, chain regression methods, respectively. See details manuscript. set.logOR.X user can manually specify log ODDs ratio exposure variable X. NULL, use log ODDs ratio summary statistics.

title: Generating data with binary outcome — generate.data.binary
text: dataframe generated survival data, columns B, indicator , X, Y, site

what: Generating data with survival outcome — generate.data.survival
title: Generating data with survival outcome — generate.data.survival
text: Generating data survival outcome

title: Generating data with survival outcome — generate.data.survival
code: generate.data.survival(   Summ.Stat,   n = NULL,   censtype = "simple",   trunc = 365,   method = 1,   set.logHR.X = NULL )

title: Generating data with survival outcome — generate.data.survival
text: Summ.Stat nested list element list summary statistics specific data site, formatted consistently output get.summstat.survival function n number samples generate, default using sample size summary statistics censtype specify type censoring, options including 'simple', 'simplebump', 'cov', 'covbump', see details manuscript trunc truncation time survival data method specify type data generation method, consistent summary statistics input. Options including 1, 2, 3, corresponding multivariate normal thresholding B, multivariate normal thresholding B, chain regression methods, respectively. See details manuscript. set.logHR.X user can manually specify log hazard ratio exposure variable X. NULL, use log hazard ratio summary statistics.

title: Generating data with survival outcome — generate.data.survival
text: dataframe generated survival data, columns B, indicator , X, Y, E, site

Getting summary statistics for data with binary outcome — get.summstat.binary
text: Y binary vector outcomes X binary vector exposures B matrix binary covariates, column representing covariate matrix categorical covariates, column representing covariate method specify type summary statistics abstracted corresponding data generation method, options including '', 1, 2, 3. '' return summary statistics can used generate data three methods, 1, 2, 3 corresponding multivariate normal thresholding B, multivariate normal thresholding B, chain regression methods, respectively. See details manuscript.

title: Getting summary statistics for data with binary outcome — get.summstat.binary

what: Getting summary statistics for data with survival outcome — get.summstat.survival

text: Getting summary statistics data survival outcome

title: Getting summary statistics for data with survival outcome — get.summstat.survival
code: get.summstat.survival(   E,   Y,   X,   B,   A,   prescription.mode = seq(30, 365, by = 30),   my.presc.K = 1,   tie.method = "efron",   method = "all",   censtype = "simple" )

title: Getting summary statistics for data with survival outcome — get.summstat.survival
text: E numeric vector event times Y binary vector outcomes X binary vector exposures B matrix binary covariates, column representing covariate matrix categorical covariates, column representing covariate prescription.mode numeric vector prescription modes exposures .presc.K numeric value number prescription modes used tie.method specifies method handling ties Cox proportional hazards model, options including 'efron', 'breslow', 'exact' method specify type summary statistics abstracted corresponding data generation method, options including '', 1, 2, 3. '' return summary statistics can used generate data three methods, 1, 2, 3 corresponding multivariate normal thresholding B, multivariate normal thresholding B, chain regression methods, respectively. See details manuscript. censtype specify type censoring, options including 'simple', 'simplebump', 'cov', 'covbump', see details manuscript

title: Getting summary statistics for data with survival outcome — get.summstat.survival
text: list summary statistics
